channel.title: English slang phrases
channel.description: Most Common English Slang Words & Phrases

item.title: I feel you
item.description: I understand and empathize with you. Eg. “I feel you. That was really unfair.”

item.title: Same here
item.description: I agree. Eg. “- I’m having a hard time studying for this exam. - Same here.”

item.title: My bad
item.description: My mistake. Eg. “My bad! I didn’t mean to do that.”

item.title: You bet
item.description: You’re welcome. Eg. “- Thanks for the jacket, David! - You bet, Sam.”

item.title: No biggie
item.description: It’s not a problem. Eg. "- Thanks for tutoring me, Tom! - No biggie, Sally."

item.title: No sweat
item.description: If you say that something is no sweat, you mean that it will not be difficult or cause problems. "Can you fix my car for me?" "No sweat!"

item.title: Laid back
item.description: Relaxed or calm. Eg. “This weekend was very laid back.”

item.title: Lame
item.description: The opposite of cool or fantastic. Eg. “That’s so lame that you can’t go out tonight.”

item.title: no sooner said than done
item.description: used to say that you will do something immediately
